resources.string: Text adjustments are unavailable for videos.

AI CAM automatically recognizes the subject and applies the best effect.\10\101. Point the camera at your subject.\102. Words related to your subject will appear on the screen and a effect will be applied.\103. Tap the Scene icon to try different effects.\10\10AI CAM can recognize the following subjects.\10- Person, people, baby\10- Pet, animal\10- Sunrise, sunset, landscape, city, snow, sky, beach, night sky, low light\10- Food, beverage, fruit, flower, text
Follow the guide to take a photo
Mode not downloaded. Recording in Auto mode...
Set to night vision according to the environment.
Cine Video does not work in Maximum mode of Battery saver.
Cannot take Auto shot with Negative.
Video recording and Cheese shutter are unavailable by server policy.
Video recording is unavailable by server policy.
The bright mode is automatically turned off because the surroundings are bright.
The bright mode is automatically turned on because the surroundings are dark.
Cannot take burst shot in Bright mode.
The bright mode has been turned off.
The bright mode has been turned on.
Tap this icon to take photos brightly in the dark.
Tap %s to take photos brightly in the dark.
Tap this icon to take photos brightly in the dark.
When you start a video, it automatically zooms in to the area of the box.
When you tap the start button, it automatically zooms out to the first state.
When you tap the start button, it automatically zooms in to the area of the box.
Pinch zoom is not supported in cine zoom.
Tap an area and drag the slider to zoom.
Zoom gesture does not work in Cine zoom.
Tap an area and drag the slider to zoom.
Tap the area to zoom in on.
- The AF ERROR. The Actuator component have issue.
- The Dragon ERROR. The Dragon component have issue.
- The Camera Swipe ERROR. The Camera Sensor have issue.
- The AF and Image Quality ERROR. The EEPROM component have issue.
- The AF ERROR. The LDAF component have issue.
Camera has been disabled because of security policies.
Camera has stopped unexpectedly, need to restart.
Camera unavailable for a while due to temporary problem. Try again.
Save the video to a new file as it exceeds the maximum file size.
Tap anywhere on the screen to take a photo when buttons are hidden in Clean view.

Take selfies with the front camera using face detection. When your face is detected, a white indicator will appear. When it turns blue, hold still. Your picture will be taken a second later.\10\10To use Auto shot, tap (#01#) and then (#36#) to turn on (#39#).
Combine pictures from the front and rear cameras to insert a selfie into a photo or video.
Take photos in the classic film look. To select a film effect, tap (#01#) and then tap (#38#).

Take selfies with the front camera. Just raise your hand. When the phone sees your hand, make a fist. The photo will be taken after 3 seconds. If you make a fist twice, the camera will take 4 photos instead of 1.
Take selfies with the front camera. Just raise your hand. When the phone sees it, make a fist. The photo will be taken after 3 seconds.
Check your selfies quickly after taking them. Take a selfie, and bring your phone up close to check.\10To turn Gesture view on or off, tap (#01#) and select (#06#).
To take 4 selfies in a row with the front camera, touch and hold (#02#) or use Gesture shot.
To take 4 selfies in a row with the front camera, touch and hold (#02#).

Control how photos are taken by adjusting the white balance (#17#), focus (#18#), brightness (#16#), ISO (#15#), shutter speed (#08#), etc.\10\10- To turn on AutoExposure-Lock, tap (#08#) or (#15#). While AutoExposure-Lock is on, brightness is not available. To return to Auto, tap (#21#).\10- To adjust the white balance and focus, tap (#17#) or (#18#). To set to Auto, tap (#19#).\10- For rear-curtain sync, set to (#30#). The flash will fire at the end of the exposure. A moving subject will show with their motion trail.

Control how videos are recorded by adjusting the microphone volume and directivity (#31#), white balance (#17#), focus (#18#), brightness (#16#), ISO (#15#), shutter speed (#08#), etc.\10\10- To adjust the volume for the microphone on the connected devices, tap (#31#). For the phone microphone, you can adjust the directivity.\10- To change the video resolution, frame rate or bit rate, tap (#01#).\10- To stabilize your video, tap (#32#).

Take multiple photos and videos in different views with the front and rear cameras.\10\10Photos and videos are assembled into a layout of two, three, or four views that you choose. Swipe the view to switch the camera. Tap (#35#) to switch between taking them all at once or in sequence.\10\10For a sequence, tap (#02#) for a photo or tap (#04#) for a video. To take them in sequence with a timer, touch and hold (#02#) or (#04#).

Tap Simple (#13#) or Auto (#14#) on the Second screen to switch between modes.\10\10- To take a photo, tap (#02#) or press one of the Volume keys.\10- To record a video, tap (#04#).\10- In Simple mode, tap anywhere on the screen to take a photo.

Tap Simple (#13#) or Basic (#14#) on the Second screen to switch between modes.\10\10- To take a photo, tap (#02#) or press one of the Volume keys.\10- To record a video, tap (#04#).\10- In Simple mode, tap anywhere on the screen to take a photo.

Tap Simple (#13#), Auto (#14#), Manual camera (#07#), Manual video (#33#), or Snap video (#34#) on Second screen to switch between modes.\10\10- To take a photo, tap (#02#) or press one of the Volume keys.\10- To record a video, tap (#04#).\10- In Simple mode, tap anywhere on the screen to take a photo.\10- In manual modes, you can take photos or record videos manually.\10- In Snap video mode, you can create a 60-second short film.
Tap (#02#) or press one of the Volume keys to take a photo. Tap (#04#) to record a video.\10\10Tap anywhere on the screen to take a photo when there is no (#02#).

Tap (#10#) to switch between Simple mode (#13#), Auto mode (#14#), and Manual mode (#07#).\10\10- To take a photo, tap (#02#) or press one of the Volume keys.\10- To record a video, tap (#04#).\10- In Simple mode, tap anywhere on the screen to take a photo.\10- In Manual mode, you can take photos manually.

Tap (#10#) to switch between Simple mode (#13#), Basic mode (#14#), and Manual mode (#07#).\10\10- To take a photo, tap (#02#) or press one of the Volume keys.\10- To record a video, tap (#04#).\10- In Simple mode, tap anywhere on the screen to take a photo.\10- In Manual mode, you can take photos manually.
Take panoramic photos by tapping (#02#) and moving your phone slowly in one direction to capture the whole scene. Continuous photos are assembled into a single image.

Make your photos pop. Pop-out picture is a photo taken with two different views. The wider view is used as a frame and can have fisheye, black & white, vignette and lens blur effects. The shape of the main view can be resized, moved and changed.\10You can even take an animated photo when you touch and hold (#02#).
You can take a photo or record a video with the CAM Plus keys.\10\10When you press a CAM Plus key, your phone will be charged for a while by the battery in CAM Plus.
You can take multiple photos or videos in different views with the front and rear cameras. Photos and videos are saved in the layout you chose. To switch the camera for a view, swipe the view.
Take brighter photos with a smaller preview while using front camera.
Take selfies with the front camera using face detection. When your face is detected, a white indicator will appear. When it turns blue, hold still. Your picture will be taken a second later.
Share photos and videos immediately after you take them. Take a photo or video, and an app icon will show. Swipe to see what apps you can share to and tap to share.

Take photos in RAW for more control when editing. To save as RAW, tap (#09#) to switch to (#11#). Images are saved in JPEG and DNG formats.\10\10This can take up more space. To free up space, delete files with (#12#) in Gallery. To delete RAW files only, go to File Manager or your computer.

Record short video clips and assemble them into a 60-second short film.\10\10Tap (#04#) to record a 3-second video clip, or touch and hold (#04#) to record as long as you want. To see a recorded clip, tap the location of the clip on the slider. To delete a clip, tap (#28#) next to the recorded clip.\10When you are done, tap Save to assemble the clips. You can watch the film and edit it in Gallery.

Your camera automatically stabilizes your photos and videos with optical image stabilization.\10\10To prevent extreme motion blur in a video - like when you are walking while recording - tap (#40#) to turn on Steady recording.
To switch between the front and rear cameras, swipe anywhere on the screen or tap (#03#).
To switch between the front and rear cameras, swipe anywhere on the screen or tap (#03#).\10With the front camera, tap (#24#) for normal photos/videos or tap (#25#) for wide-angle photos/videos.

To switch between the front and rear cameras, swipe anywhere on the screen or tap (#03#). With the rear camera, you can switch between normal view and wide view. To switch, pinch open or drag the zoom slider. You can also tap (#24#)/(#25#).

Tap (#27#) to record a video that will play faster than normal.\10You can also change the recording speed. When the recording speed is high, the video will be more compressed. Sound is not recorded for Time-lapse video.

To record a video in slow motion, tap (#26#). \10\10To record a time-lapse video, tap (#27#). The recorded video will play back faster than normal. You can also change the recording speed. When the recording speed is high, the video will be more compressed. Sound is not recorded for Time-lapse video.
You can use OIS to remove motion blur when you take a photo or video. Switch to (#01#) for videos, and you can further remove motion blur especially when you are walking or moving a lot.

Your camera automatically stabilizes your photos and videos with optical image stabilization.\10\10To prevent extreme motion blur in a video - like when you are walking while recording - turn on Steady recording.

When you are taking a photo of moving lights, a stream of water or a sunset, try changing the ISO to a lower number and slowing down the shutter speed (S). Also, try adjusting the white balance (WB) to make the warmer or colder colors stand out.
Show your recent photos and videos on the camera preview
For 18:9, Camera roll was turned off.
Camera is unavailable due to no permissions.
Camera is unavailable due to no storage.
Cannot use Cine Video in Maximum mode of Battery saver.
Drag slider to adjust guide\'s transparency
Use an image as a guide to take photos with the same composition.\10 \10Any photo in Gallery can be used as a guide. Drag the slider to set the photo\'s transparency.
Add a photo from Gallery as your first shot.
Switch between taking the 2 shots at once or in order.
Take them at once or separately.
Take 2 photos and/or videos in order by tapping #01# at the top of the camera preview.
Take 2 photos in order by tapping for #01# at the top of the camera preview.
Take 2 photos and/or videos in order by tapping #01# at the top of the camera preview. Tap #02# in the top left to use a photo from Gallery as the first shot.
Tap #02# in the top left to use a photo from Gallery as the first shot.
Take 2 photos or videos at once by tapping #03#.
Take 2 photos at once by tapping #03#.
Take 4 photos and/or 3-second videos to save as one photo or video.\10\10Tap on a square to take or retake a shot.
Take 4 photos to save as one photo.\10\10Tap on a square to take or retake a shot.
Tap on any shot to retake it.
Tap on any shot to retake it.
Take four shots organized in a square
Use an image as a guide to take photos with the same composition
Take a photo matching the composition of another photo
Take a shot and preview it right away
Take a shot and preview it right away
For Camera roll, photo size was changed from 18:9 to default.
High-quality video such as movie could be recorded by using Cine Preset and Point Zoom.
Record video like what you see in the movies.
Create stunning videos with the look of a major motion picture by using Cine Effect, a set of effects created jointly with film professionals, and Point Zoom for smooth zoom in/out.
The original guide can not be removed.
Remove this guide? The photos taken will remain in Gallery.
Press and hold to see the photo.
Cannot open during a video call.
Cannot record while another app is using audio.
Cannot use camera while connected to HDMI.
Cannot open due to not enough space on the internal storage.
There are no apps for this.
The camera has stopped due to being outside the guidelines.
Unable to record video during call.
Recording may not be available depending on video resolution while using Miracast.
Photos and videos cannot be tagged with locations due to no permission.
Cannot take Burst shot with film effect.
Recording without film effect… Effect does not work in %s video.
Recording without film effect… Effect does not work in UHD video.
Cannot take Burst shot with a filter.
Change the order by pressing and holding the Filter.
Recording with no filter… Filters don\'t work in %s video.
Make sure the lens is not covered
Let you know when the rear wide-angle lens is covered
Photos are taken every 3 seconds and saved as a GIF file.
Outlines will appear around things in focus with Focus peaking.
You can place your finger on the fingerprint sensor to take a selfie. To turn this off, go to Settings.
You can tap the Power key to take a selfie. To turn this off, go to Settings.
You can place your finger on the Power key to take a selfie. To turn this off, go to Settings.
Make a fist to take a photo
Try taking high-quality picture in manual mode like expert.
Take photos like the pros by applying the settings of other photos in Manual camera.
Take photos like a pro by applying settings from existing photos to your own in Manual camera mode.
Take photos like a pro by applying settings from existing photos to your own in Manual camera mode.\10Turn on Graphy photos in the Camera settings.
Take photos like a pro by applying settings from existing photos to your own in Manual camera mode.\10Turn on Graphy photos in the Camera settings.\10The supplied photos may be changed.
To add this photo, Graphy photo has been turned on in the Camera settings.
Overexposed. Try adjusting ISO and shutter speed.
Underexposed. Try adjusting ISO and shutter speed.
Up to 30 Graphy photos can be added. Replace the oldest photo with this photo?
For more photos, download the Graphy app in Google Play Store. Data charges may apply.
Apply the settings of another photo to take a photo
Apply settings from existing photos to your own
Record videos in HDR10 for vivid colors and higher quality

Capture everything around you by tapping the shutter button and moving your phone slowly in one direction. Follow the middle guideline in the direction of the arrow as you pan. Continue until you\'ve rotated 360 degrees. Photos are taken continuously and assembled into a single image. To record sound, tap on the sound icon.
Automatically recognizes the subject and applies the best effect. Press the recognized icon and select various effects.
AI CAM automatically recognizes the following 8 objects.\10(Person, pet, food, sunrise, sunset, landscape, city, flower)
- Cine Effect: Try recording video by using a variety of effects. To preview an effect, touch and hold the effect.\10- Point Zoom: Zoom in to the spot you tapped on.
When recording in Cine video mode, videos will be saved as HDR 10 to show a wide range of colors.
Create a GIF by taking up to 20 photos 3 seconds apart.
Take your food photos and videos in this mode. The colors of the food will be enhanced and brightened. You can also adjust the colors to your liking.
Take your food photos and videos in this mode. The colors of the food will be enhanced and brightened. You can also adjust the white balance to your liking.
Take your food photos in this mode. The colors of the food will be enhanced and brightened. You can also adjust the white balance to your liking.
Use the camera to search the web for products and images.
You can also scan documents to copy or translate text and scan business cards to save as contacts.

Control how photos and videos are taken by adjusting the focus, shutter speed (SS), ISO, white balance (WB), exposure value (EV), etc.\10\10- Lock auto-exposure: Tap (#21#). You can adjust the exposure in SS or ISO. To adjust EV or unlock, tap (#20#).\10- Adjust white balance or focus: Tap WB or FOCUS. To set things back to auto, tap AUTO.\10- Use rear-curtain sync: Set the flash to (#30#). The flash will fire at the end of the exposure. A moving subject will show with their motion trail.\10\10Manual video\10Adjust the mic volume by tapping (#41#). For the phone mic, you can adjust the directivity.

Control how photos and videos are taken by adjusting the focus, shutter speed (S), ISO, white balance (WB), exposure value (EV), etc.\10\10- Lock auto-exposure: Tap the AE-L button and adjust the exposure in S or ISO. To adjust EV or unlock, tap the button again.\10- Adjust white balance or focus: Tap the WB or Focus button. To set things back to auto, tap the Auto button.

Control how photos and videos are taken by adjusting the focus, shutter speed (S), ISO, white balance (WB), exposure value (EV), etc.\10\10- Auto-exposure lock (AE-L): Lets you manually adjust ISO or shutter speed.\10- Focus peaking: Shows an outline of what is in focus when focusing manually.

Control how photos and videos are taken by adjusting the focus, shutter speed (S), ISO, white balance (WB), exposure (EV), etc. \10\10- Auto: Automatically adjusts the focus, shutter speed (S), ISO, white balance (WB) and exposure (EV). \10- Focus peaking: Shows an outline of what is in focus when focusing manually.
Manual video\10Adjust the mic volume by tapping the Mic button. For the phone mic, you can adjust the directivity.
Manual video\10Adjust the mic volume, gain, low cut filter (LCF) and limiter (LMT) by tapping the mic icon. For the phone mic, you can adjust the directivity.
Manual video\10Adjust the mic volume, gain, low cut filter (LCF) and limiter (LMT) by tapping the mic icon.
Manual video\10Adjust the mic volume, gain, low cut filter (LCF) and limiter (LMT) by tapping the mic icon.
- Mic settings: Adjust the mic volume, gain, low cut filter (LCF) and limiter (LMT) by tapping the mic icon. For the phone mic, you can adjust the directivity.
- Mic settings: Adjust the mic volume, gain, low cut filter (LCF) and limiter (LMT) by tapping the mic icon.
Manual video\10Adjust the mic volume by tapping the Mic button.
Manual video\10Adjust the mic volume by tapping the Mic button.
Manual camera\10- Graphy: If you use Graphy, you can immediately apply settings of the ISO and shutter speed of recommended picture you want.
- \'Save as HDR 10\' will record videos in HDR 10 to show a wide range of colors.

- Display LUT (Lookup table): When a video is recorded with Save as LG-Cine Log turned on, the preview is shown in lower saturation. To adjust the exposure and contrast of the preview, you can apply the Display LUT and preview the video with the transformed colors for the phone display. Note that this does not affect the output.

Take multiple photos and videos in a layout of two, three or four views with the front and rear cameras.\10\10Swipe a view to switch its camera. You can take them all at once or one by one. When you are taking them one by one, you can touch and hold the shutter button to take them consecutively with a 2-second timer before each one.

Take a panoramic photo by tapping (#02#) and moving your phone slowly in one direction to capture the whole scene. Follow the middle guideline in the direction of the arrow as you pan. Photos are taken continuously and are assembled into a single image. You can capture a wider photo when you are in portrait orientation.

Capture the whole scene by tapping the shutter button and moving your phone slowly in one direction. Follow the middle guideline in the direction of the arrow as you pan. Photos are taken continuously and are assembled into a single image.

Make your photos pop. Pop-out picture is a photo taken with two different views. The wider view is used as a frame and can have fisheye, black & white, vignette and lens blur effects. Also, you can change the shape of the main view.

Make your photos pop. Pop-out Picture is a photo taken with two different views. The wider view is used as a frame and can have fisheye, black & white, vignette and lens blur effects. Also, you can change the shape of the main view.
Change important settings fast from the bottom of the screen. You can change photo size, video resolution and timer.
Change important settings fast from the bottom of the screen. You can change FullVision, photo size, video resolution and timer.
Press and hold the Record button to preview the recording size.
To record a video on slow motion, tap (#26#).\10You can record more slowly moving subjects than moving in the real world.
Record a video that plays in slow motion.
Record a video that plays in slow motion. Videos are recorded at 240 FPS and at 120 FPS in wide angle.
Record a video that plays in slow motion. Videos can be up to 240 FPS for HD and 120 FPS for FHD.

Record a 60-second short film. Tap (#04#) to record a 3-second clip, or touch and hold (#04#) to record as long as you want.\10\10Tap on a clip on the slider to see a preview of the clip, and tap (#28#) to delete it. The screen orientation does not change during the recording. After you save the film, you can watch and edit it in Gallery.

Record a 60-second short film. Tap the shutter button to record a 3-second video clip, or touch and hold the shutter button to record as long as you want. Tap on a clip on the slider to see a preview of the clip.

Take 2 photos and/or 3-second videos. You can take them at the same time or one by one. You can also use any photo you\'ve previously taken.\10To switch between the front and rear cameras, swipe on a square. Pinch or pinch open to adjust the zoom right before saving.

Take 2 photos at the same time or separately. You can also use any photo you\'ve previously taken.\10To switch between the front and rear cameras, swipe on a square. Pinch or pinch open to adjust the zoom right before saving.
Take 4 photos and/or 3-second videos in a 2x2 grid to save as one photo or video. You can tap on any of the squares to take or retake the shot.
Take 4 photos in a 2x2 grid to save as one photo. You can tap on any of the squares to take or retake the shot.

Take photos by following the composition of another photo. You can use any photo from Gallery as a guide. You can set how transparent the guide photo is over the camera preview. Photos taken are saved in Gallery and can be used to create a GIF.

Take photos by following the composition of another photo. You can use any photo from Gallery as a guide and set how transparent it is over the camera preview. You can have up to 8 guides at a time. Photos taken are saved in Gallery and can be used to create a GIF.

Use an image as a guide to take photos with the same composition. You can use any photo from Gallery as a guide and set how transparent it is over the camera preview. You can have up to %d guides at a time. Photos taken are saved in Gallery and can be used to create a GIF.
Take a photo or video and preview it right away on the other half of the screen.

Tap Auto (#14#), Manual camera (#07#) or Manual video (#33#) on the Second screen to switch modes.\10\10- Take a photo: Tap (#02#) or press one of the Volume keys.\10- Record a video: Tap (#04#).\10\10Take selfies with front camera\10- One selfie: Raise your hand. When the camera sees your hand, make a fist. The photo will be taken after 3 seconds.\10- Four selfies: Touch and hold (#02#). You can also raise your hand and when the camera sees your hand, make a fist twice.

Take a photo by tapping the shutter button or pressing one of the Volume keys.\10\10Take selfies with front camera\10- One selfie: Raise your hand. When the camera sees your hand, make a fist. The photo will be taken after 3 seconds.\10- Four selfies: Touch and hold the shutter button. You can also raise your hand and when the camera sees your hand, make a fist twice.

Take a photo by tapping the shutter button or pressing one of the Volume keys. You can also tap the Power key to take a selfie. \10\10Take selfies with front camera\10- One selfie: Raise your hand. When the camera sees your hand, make a fist. The photo will be taken after 3 seconds.\10- Four selfies: You can raise your hand and when the camera sees your hand, make a fist twice.
Take a photo by tapping the shutter button or pressing a Volume key.
Take a selfie by tapping the Power key.
To record a video, press QuickButton. Press it again to stop recording.

Take selfies with front camera\10- One selfie: Raise your hand. When the camera sees your hand, make a fist. The photo will be taken after 3 seconds.\10- Four selfies: You can raise your hand and when the camera sees your hand, make a fist twice.
You can also drag the shutter button to zoom.
Record a video that plays back faster than normal. You can adjust how fast the video records. The higher the recording speed, the more the video will be compressed. Sound is not recorded.
When you play or share videos with Hi-Fi audio, the Hi-Fi audio will only work in apps that support Hi-Fi.
Cannot record due to the high temperature.
Recording video... Press the Hot key again to stop.
Recording video… Press QuickButton again to stop.
Use Look Up Tables (LUTs, a way to alter colors in a video using a mathematical formula), created with the help of film professionals, to record high-quality videos resembling major motion pictures.
Touch anywhere on the screen and apply Point Zoom for a smooth, jitter-free zoom effect.
Take photos in RAW for more control when editing. Images are saved in JPEG and DNG formats. This can take up more space.

Your phone can share its approximate location with apps and services like maps, shopping and weather.\10\10Apps and services that use your location should inform you. Read the privacy policy of any app or service provider you\'re considering to understand how they collect, use and share your location information before you use them.\10\10Determining your location will use the mobile network. Data usage will apply.
To unpin this screen, touch and hold the Back and Overview buttons.
For earphones, recording is available only.
Mic settings are unavailable when FPS is set to 120.
Mic settings are unavailable except mic change when FPS is set to 120.
Wide-angle camera is unavailable when Save as HDR10 is on.
Display LUT is on for clarity and vividness. Tap Display LUT to turn off.
Turn off save as LG-Cine Log
Turn on save as LG-Cine Log
Wide-angle camera is unavailable when Save as LG-Cine Log is on.

With the dual capture function, wider views are saved together with normal view photos.\10If you turn off the Dual Capture, you can take pictures that look like framed pictures with two different views.
Change the order by pressing and holding the Mode.
Take a photo with normal camera mode.
Keep subject at least 1.3 feet away.
Portrait is unavailable because no face was recognized in the saved photo.
Portrait is unavailable because the subject was not recognized in the saved photo.
Make sure the lens is not covered.
Portrait is unavailable when there is not enough light.
Cannot recognize face for Portrait due to not enough light.
Portrait is unavailable because the subject cannot be recognized.
Sound recorder is off in panorama mode.
Sound recorder is on in panorama mode.
Take photos in #01#, the highest quality.
Take photos in #02#, the aspect ratio optimized for the entire screen.
Take photos in #02#, the aspect ratio optimized for FullVision display.
Take photos in #01#, the aspect ratio optimized for the entire screen.\10To take photos in the highest quality, change the photo size to #02# in the Camera settings.
Touch and hold (###) to take an animated photo.

Make your photos pop. Pop-out picture is a photo taken with two different views. The wider view is used as a frame with various effects. The shape of the main view can be resized, moved and changed.\10You can even take an animated photo when you touch and hold (#02#).
The recording has stopped due to the storage being full.
Recording started with mic on earphones
Save as JPEG and RAW button
Video is saved in the LG-Cine Log format for greater flexibility in post-production.
Take bright and clear photos/videos in the dark. Not available in UHD and 60fps.
Take bright and clear photos/videos in the dark. Not available in UHD, 60fps, and wide angle.
Take bright and clear photos/videos when the surroundings gets dark. Select \'Manual\' to turn on manually by tapping Super Bright Camera icon, or select \'Auto\' to detect and turn on automatically.

Take bright and clear photos/videos when the surroundings gets dark. Select \'Manual\' to turn on manually by tapping Super Bright Camera icon(%s), or select \'Auto\' to detect and turn on automatically.
Take bright and clear photos/videos when the surroundings gets dark. Select \'Manual\' to turn on manually by tapping Super Bright Camera icon, or select \'Auto\' to detect and turn on automatically.
Record the action before and after you take a photo
Take a High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo/video that combines photos/videos for more detail in dark and bright areas
Record a video in high quality sound.
Record a video in high quality sound
Take a photo by saying \"%1$s,\" \"%2$s\" or \"%3$s\"
Take a photo by saying \"%1$s,\" \"%2$s,\" \"%3$s\" or \"%4$s\"
See an outline of the things in focus when focusing manually
Check your selfie after you take it by bringing your phone closer
Take a photo in RAW for more editing control. Images are saved in both DNG and JPEG formats.
Take a selfie with a raised hand made into a fist (Gesture shot) or with your face detected (Auto shot)
Reduce motion blur in photos and videos such as when you are walking. Optical image stabilization is used regardless of this setting.
Reduce motion blur in photos and videos
HDR corrects backlight with multiple exposure techniques.
Track and maintain focus on a moving object
Track and maintain focus on a moving object (FHD and HD only)
Take bright and clear photos/videos when the surroundings gets dark. Select \'Manual\' to turn on manually by tapping Bright mode icon, or select \'Auto\' to detect and turn on automatically.
Take bright and clear photos/videos when the surroundings gets dark. Select \'Manual\' to turn on manually by tapping Bright mode icon(%s), or select \'Auto\' to detect and turn on automatically.
Use the camera to search for info on a subject
Google Lens does not work in the current language. QLens will be used instead.
Google Lens is unavailable. QLens will be used instead.
Google Lens may not work in all languages.
QLens will be used for LG apps that do not work with Google Lens.
To take a selfie, hold still
Saved to Quick Video Editor album
Close Quick Video Editor and try again.
Copy this video to the internal storage and try again.
Not enough space. Delete some files and try again.
Cannot share this video. Try again later.
Your video was saved. Edit this video?
Not enough space on internal storage to store temporary clips. To free up space, delete some files.
Previous clips will be deleted to start a new snap movie. Delete?
Your video was saved. The video can be edited in Gallery.
Tap #02# to record for 3 seconds, or touch and hold up to a minute.

You can assemble short video clips into a 60-second short film.\10\10The screen orientation will not change during the recording. To see a recorded clip, tap the location of the clip on the slider. Then, tap (#28#) to delete the clip.
All burst shot photos will be deleted. Delete?
